name: Diebold's Hot Spiced Cider
author: Paula Diebold
instructions:
Pour cider into large pan. Cut orange in half and squeeze some of the juice into the cider. Drop the two orange halves into the cider. Place spices in a cheese cloth and tie with a string--a tea ball also works--and drop into the cider. Simmer for 20 minutes. Do not bring to a full boil. Serve hot.
Note: Once made, you can pour it into a sanitary container and refrigerate. Then you can pour a cup at a time and heat it in your microwave.
